person_020.name: NehemiahGrew
person_020.description: English plant anatomist and physiologist, known as the 'Father of Plant Anatomy'. FRSL.

person_033.name: Torbern OlafBergman
person_033.description: Swedish chemist and mineralogist. At some point Davy acquired a set of letters from Bergman to Franz Schwediaur written in the 1780s which are retained in the Royal Institution (RI MS HD/27/A). ForMemRSL.

person_050.name: Louis NicolasVauquelin
person_050.description: French pharmacist and chemist who met Davy in Paris in 1813. ForMemRSL.

person_226.name: ThomasThomson
person_226.description: Scottish chemist and mineralogist whose writings contributed to the early spread of Dalton's atomic theory. FRSL.

person_240.name: ErasmusDarwin
person_240.description: Physician and natural philosopher who was member of the Lunar Society and friend of Priestley and Watt; also a correspondent with Beddoes. FRSL.

person_024.name: Thomas AndrewKnight
person_024.description: Knight was a botanist and horticulturalist. He was the second president of the Royal Horticulture Society. Davy frequently fished on Knight's esates in the Welsh Marches. FRSL.

person_022.name: Henri-LouisDuhamel du Monceau
person_022.description: French physician, naval engineer and botanist. ForMemRSL.

person_124.name: FrancisBacon
person_124.description: English lawyer, politician and natural philosopher. His influential writings encouraged experimentation and the use of induction in investigating the natural world. He also recommended establishing institutions to promote collaborative research.

person_937.name: JohnJay
person_937.description: American statesman, patriot, diplomat, abolitionist, signatory of the Treaty of Paris, and a Founding Father of the United States. Davy quotes him as the author of a letter on a species of apple with one sweet and one sour side.

person_936.name: Henry VIII
person_936.description: King of England from 22 April 1509 until his death in 1547.

place_878.name: United States
place_878.description: The U.S. is a country of 50 states covering a vast swath of North America, with Alaska in the northwest and Hawaii extending the nationâ€™s presence into the Pacific Ocean.

otherwork_136.name: The georgics of Virgil translated: by William Sotheby. Esq.
otherwork_136.author: William Sothby's Translations of Virgil's Georgics
